thread.title: Croatia qualifies for Euro 2016 with help from Italy
thread.title_full: Croatia qualifies for Euro 2016 with help from Italy

title: Croatia qualifies for Euro 2016 with help from Italy
text:
(Photo: The Associated Press)
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE ROME (AP) — Croatia qualified for its fourth consecutive European Championship with a 1-0 win at Malta on Tuesday to claim second place in Group H after Italy came from behind to beat Norway 2-1.
Ivan Perisic scored midway through the first half for Croatia.
In Rome, Alessandro Florenzi scored one goal and set up another for Graziano Pelle as the Azzurri overturned a 1-0 halftime deficit.
Ghana-born midfielder Alexander Teffey scored on Norway's only shot of the first half.
Italy won the group with 24 points and Croatia —which had a point deducted for a swastika that was painted on the pitch before a match against Italy — finished second with 20.
Norway took third place with 19 points.
